title: Girl, 17, killed by stray bullet at western Tennessee party
content:
BROWNSVILLE, Tenn. (AP) - Authorities say a teenage girl was fatally shot and several others hurt after a fight broke out at a party in western Tennessee.
Haywood County Sheriff Melvin Bond tells news outlets that 17-year-old Elia Hernandez was hiding inside the house early Sunday when she was shot and killed by a stray bullet.
Hernandez's friend Madie Jowers tells The Jackson Sun (http://bit.ly/291u5LP ) that Hernandez had just graduated from Crockett County High School in May and had signed up for classes at Jackson State Community College.
Two men were also shot at the party, while another man was severely beaten.
Nineteen-year-old Quin Love was arrested in connection with the shooting. Bond says formal charges are likely to be filed Monday morning against Love. It's unclear whether he has an attorney.
